section.title: Summary
section.para: EditorScheme lets one easily switch between predefined color & style combinations for jEdit's TextArea and a number of jEdit's Plugins.
EditorScheme support setting colors & styles for the following plugins:

section.title: Usage
section.para: EditorScheme lets you can create new schemes, switch between existing schemes, and update existing schemes.

section.title: Creating Schemes
section.para: To create a new scheme, select Plugins -> Editor Scheme Selector. Press New to create a scheme based on the current settings. The scheme file will be saved in the schemes directory in your jEdit settings directory.

section.title: Switching Schemes
section.para: To switch schemes, select Plugins -> Editor Scheme Selector. On the left, is a a list of available schemes, and on the right you can select which sets of properties to set when applying a scheme. Select the scheme in the list box to apply it.
To revert to the settings you had when you first opened the dialog, select (Initial Settings).

section.title: Updating Schemes
section.para: To update a scheme, select Plugins -> Editor Scheme Selector. On the left is a list of available schemes, and on the right you can select which sets of properties to update. Schemes with a lock icon ( READ_ONLY ) are read-only and cannot be updated. All the schemes provided with EditorScheme are read-only. Schemes with a diamond icon ( NORMAL ) can be updated. Choose the scheme you wish to update and select Update.
(Initial Settings) are the settings from when you opened the Editor Scheme Selector dialog, and will not change as you switch between schemes in the dialog.

section.title: Submitting Schemes
section.para: To submit schemes for inclusion with EditorScheme, please send them to Ollie Rutherfurd at <oliver@jedit.org>. It would be really nice to have schemes from different jEdit users.

listitem.para: Added DarkBrine scheme, submitted by Matt Gilbert.
Updated for jEdit 4.2pre2 deferred loading API.
Added support for new token types introduced in 4.2pre1: COMMENT3, COMMENT4, LITERAL3, LITERAL4, and KEYWORD4.
EditorScheme Selector to be a menu item, instead of a sub-menu of Editor Scheme.
Removed Gray, jEdit 3.2, High Constrast, & Light Blue schemes.
Added support for foldLine property and updated existing schemes.
Fixed bug that prevented one from creating new schemes until the EditorScheme Selector dialog has been displayed at least once.
Added "Erich's Scheme", a scheme submitted by Erich Schifferl.
Removed New Scheme action. Creating schemes can now be done in the EditorScheme Selector dialog.
Modified Update behavior in EditorScheme Selector, to use the current settings instead of (Initial Settings).
Properties can be applied in sets.
Added more properties (Console, Error-List, jDiff, White-Space).
Added a couple schemes, added props to a couple.
Schemes can be updated from current properties.
